If you are passionate about modern data platforms and want to be part of shaping the future of Tryg, then we would like to hear from you!Join us in creating value through data insights and by exploring modern data platforms to deliver value.Why Tryg?        This is exactly the right moment to join us, as we focus strongly on digitalization and innovation of our services and business processes. Data is an incredibly important asset for Tryg, and you will make your mark on the platforms we develop.               Join our dedicated team of top professionals and make Tryg's strategic ambitions possible through the implementation of an advanced and comprehensive data architecture. You will be given great personal responsibility and extensive opportunities to learn and grow your knowledge.               Also we have multiple opportunities within Tryg to shape your Data engineering career.       About the Job | Data Engineer         Tryg has a long tradition for using data to understand risks. We are now taking this experience to the next level and expanding our activities to many different customer-centric initiatives. Customer touchpoint data is scattered in a multitude of different systems; therefore, we are building an integrated data platform for easy, purpose-driven, and compliant access to data.               In your role as our new Data Engineer, you will get full responsibility for implementing claim domain data sources in the data layer. The work comprises disciplines such as:        Data analysisData modelingImplementation of streaming ETL Data quality tests        Our tech stack is ever growing as we evolve and stay up to date with the technology As a Data Engineer you will mainly be exposed to:       Java (Kstreams) – Java, in combination with our customer framework, is the main language used in all our data pipeline.SQL – This is purely used for analysis, as all pipeline work will be pure streamingKafka – Kafka is used as the streaming platform. Our pipelines work purely on Kafka; both input and outputGIT – Everything must go into a Git repository, and together with our DevOps team we are moving toward a GitOps setup.GraphQL – Used as an integration layer to other systems to read data from        Through collaboration with our DevOps team you will likely also be exposed to, Docker, K8s, Operators, CI Pipelines               Collaboration is key, as your daily activities will occur in close cooperation with stakeholders.       About you        You most likely have a background in a data related field. You are used to analyzing and understanding large datasets. Solid experience with data analysis or java development is preferred. Up until now you might only have worked with batch processing, but want to expand your skillset with streaming – a journey we look forward accompanying you on!               Prior work exposure with Insurance domain is advantage but not a pre-requisite. As our data engineering tech stack is heavily focused around Kafka and streaming, it is an advantage if you can demonstrate experience with some of these.               Great curiosity and an eternal willingness to invest in your own development are important to us. We are constantly looking for smarter ways of working and your contribution is important.               Tryg has teams in several countries, so a natural curiosity and understanding of cultural differences are expected to succeed in the role.       Curious?        If you recognize yourself in the description, please send your application as soon as possible. Application deadline:         July 8th 2022. Interviews are held on an ongoing basis.               If you have questions or want to know more, you are welcome to contact Shaji Balakrishnan at         +45 2058 5983, shaji.balakrishnan@tryg.dk or Andreas Harmuth at +45 2912 9070, andreas.harmuth@tryg.dk.               We look forward to receive your application       Job Requisition ID: 23927       We encourage everyone regardless of gender, age, background, disability or origin to apply for the position. We are proud to have high employee satisfaction, strong professionalism and equal opportunities to develop your career in the Tryg Group. Tryg is in the process of acquiring the ownership of Trygg-Hansa in Sweden and Codan in Norway. When the transaction is completed, we will be the largest non-life insurance company in Scandinavia. Every day we strive – each in our own way – to create peace of mind and affect the lives of most Scandinavians. Read more at www.tryg.comHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Vi søger en Advanced Quality Engineer til Polytech A/S i Bramming. Har du redskabskassen i orden til at arbejde i en af verdens førende virksomheder indenfor sit felt? -så er hér en spændende mulighed for dig. Polytech bestræber sig kontinuerligt på at gøre vindenergi endnu bedre. Man udvikler, designer og producerer nogle af de mest avancerede systemer til beskyttelse og optimering af vindmøller world wide. Polytech er et globalt selskab med virksomheder i Danmark, Tyskland, Kina og Mexico. Hovedkontoret er beliggende i Bramming. Stillingen   Du får en væsentlig opgave i form af projektdeltagelse som QHSE ”One Point of Contact” hvor du repræsenterer QHSE-kompetencecentret og er ansvarlig for opsætning samt opfølgning af Quality Plans for op til 24 deliveries – denne del af rollen skønnes at udgøre ca. 40 % af arbejdstiden. De konkrete arbejdsopgaver vil i øvrigt omfatte:8D reklamationsbehandlingRoot Cause SolvingPFMEA, Quality plans, PPAP, MSA og gerne DEMEAKvalitetssikring i fabrikkerne.Godkendelse af arbejdsinstruktionerLøbende kundekontaktOg sikkert en hel del ad hoc-opgaver i takt med kendskabet til virksomheden, produkterne og kunderne øges.Du skal regne med 10-20 rejsedage årligt. Kvalifikationer. Du har en teknisk uddannelse på min. BSc-niveau. Relevante uddannelser kunne være kemiingeniør, P-, M-, eller E-ingeniør. En Black Belt- og projektlederuddannelse vil være en fordel Hvis du har en teknologuddannelse med relevant efteruddannelse og efterfølgende solid praktisk erfaring med området er dette også en mulighed. Du har min. 5 års erfaring efter endt uddannelse fra en international, udviklingsorienteret produktionsvirksomhed – heraf skal min. 3 år være indenfor kvalitetsområdet. Du er fortrolig med ISO 9001, og har ideelt også arbejdet med APQP4Wind eller IATF 16949. Du behersker dansk og engelsk på forhandlingsniveau i skrift og tale. Du er rutineret bruger af MS Officepakken og avanceret bruger af Excel. Erfaring med BI-systemer vil være en fordel.  På det personlige plan kan du genkende dig selv i følgende:En troværdig og tillidsvækkende kollega og samarbejdspartner med en naturlig autoritet.Skaber begejstring og teamånd og brænder igennem på Q-området.Er en dygtig og synlig kommunikator på alle organisatoriske niveauer.Har analytiske evner, er struktureret, har god overblikskapacitet og stærke prioriteringsevnerEr selvkørende.Er resultatorienteret, proaktiv i tanke og handling.Har du et godt humør, gør det ikke noget.Virksomheden Polytech er grundlagt i 1994 og har siden da udviklet sig til at være en af de førende internationale spillere indenfor udvikling, design, test, produktion og service til vindindustrien. Helt overordnet vil man gerne bidrage til, at verdens energiforbrug udelukkende kan dækkes af vedvarende energikilder baseret på en bæredygtig teknologi. Polytech har en lang række avancerede løsninger inden for forkantsbeskyttelse, lynbeskyttelse, add-ons til vinger, diverse komponenter samt transportløsninger. Virksomheden er i mange sammenhænge den foretrukne samarbejdspartner for de største og mest ambitiøse aktører i vindbranchen – over 60 % af verdens vindmøller har monteret udstyr eller komponenter fra Polytech. Du bliver ansat i en international, udviklingsorienteret og vækstorienteret virksomhed hvor du får gode muligheder for at udvikle dig fagligt og personligt og spille en afgørende rolle i Polytechs fortsatte positive udvikling. Læs mere på www.polytech.com Ansøgning Vi tilstræber at besætte stillingen så hurtigt som muligt. Der er derfor ingen ansøgningsfrist, og vi inviterer løbende kandidater ind til samtale. Stillingen vil derfor være opslået, indtil vi har fundet den rigtige kandidat. Har du behov for at høre mere om firma og job, er du velkommen til at kontakte direktør Carsten Spanget, Keyselector, på +45 20997133. Alle henvendelser behandles naturligvis fortroligt og dine data tilgår først Polytech efter direkte aftale. Du er velkommen til at rekvirere en uddybende beskrivelse af virksomheden og stillingen via info@keyselector.dk. Du kan søge stillingen ved at trykke på knappen ”Søg Stilling” og via den uploade dit CV. En kort motiveret ansøgning er velkommen – det er dog ikke et krav.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Requisition ID: 26609          Job Location(s): Nordborg, DK     Job Description Danfoss Power Solutions is looking for a sound Manufacturing Data Engineer who can drive digital data-, visualization- and decision improvements to reach high ambitions within the Future Factory project of our Controls Division.  Is it exciting for you to support and challenge the operations organization in ensuring proven optimization plans and roadmaps, through data analysis and digitalization? Do you want to use your technical knowledge to improve processes and technologies? Are you looking to join a dedicated team and be part of an international organization with numerous developmental opportunities? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment with a multitude of tasks? Then you could be our new manufacturing data engineer - Future Factory, based out of Nordborg, Denmark. Job Responsibilities The position as manufacturing data engineer within Future Factory is created with the ambition of optimizing the technologies and productivity in a production that has an annual turnover of more than one billion DKK, by utilizing the manufacturing data as a resource. As a manufacturing data engineer, you will be positioned in the Future Factory team.  Your primary goal will be to develop and implement Digital Performance Boards across the SVS manufacturing in L2 and subsequent globally in SVS. These boards are part of a recently approved pilot, which will ensure SVS a more digitized and real-time-based tool. The pilot is the first of its kind, and therefore there will be high expectations for integration and utilization.  By being the new manufacturing data engineer, you are guaranteed a versatile position with a great variance of work tasks, as the position is intended to contribute to the following 3 areas:  Future Factory: Support of data analysis as a basis for initiating major technology projects. In addition, the opportunity to ensure compliance between current capacities and future requirements/technology. Also, the position will be given the responsibility of the Blackbird Software – maintaining the system, develop report, tools and problem solving.  Operations Excellence: Securing compliance and link of corporate targets to the operations team and subsequent alignment with Future Factory.  Operations Team: Support and analysis, to enable data-driven decision-making and execution of projects to ensure continued productivity and savings. Also, it is possible to initiate own projects based on analysis from Blackbird Software (real-time monitoring of production equipment). As our manufacturing data engineer, you will have responsibility of giving the right input to operation, based on data analysis.  With this position, you will be part of a small, but dedicated team of colleagues, where you will receive full support and sparring when needed, also in collaboration with the existing operations team. Success criteria are that the projects will be completed by the agreed upon deadline and scope. All projects are executed in parallel with the operations organization, thus it is essential that you can deliver solid communications to ensure the best possible handover to operations.  Projects as our new Manufacturing Data Engineer:Development and implementation of Digital Performance Boards.Blackbird integration on critical manufacturing lines.Data-base architecture in SVS NOR.Data-analysis and delivery to operations corporate team.Simulation of future state within productivity and optimization.Input to roadmap within technology and processes.Digital real-time monitoring of processes and products.Optimization and utilization of existing equipment.Background & Skills We are looking for a candidate who can deliver able results, through hard and dedicated work. Furthermore, we would prefer you to hold a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Production, Mechanical, Robotic Engineering or Data Science. Experience is preferred in running projects independently - even if this includes hands-on on technology/robots. Experience from a similar position, preferably in a larger production company.You have worked with new technology/systems/data sources/databases.Furthermore, you are familiar with system integration, including SAP, MES, Guide-online-systems, simulation tools or similar.You can think logically, practically and use your knowledge to deliver results and analytics in a big organization.You demonstrate drive, along with a positive approach to team spirit and results.You are fluent in written and spoken Danish and English. You are a Self-starter – be proactive in determining goals and objectives and in pursuing the necessary course of action. Having a proven and effective self-propelled drive, in combination with a solid independency and service mindset.  You possess a natural curiosity, but at the same time can incorporate research specifics into projects and individual tasks when necessary and convey these topics to a broad variety of stakeholders. You can also challenge stakeholders, shining a light on the essence of your findings in relation to managing projects and change management processes efficiently.  You have a natural interest in automation, technology, data, and system integration. You strive for new knowledge and take the initiative yourself if the current knowledge is not sufficient. You thrive on running projects both theoretically and practically and can see yourself maintaining a time schedule. To succeed with the project, many stakeholders must be involved, and it is a crucial factor that you are an effective communicator and team player.  For further information about this position, please contact Manager, Martin Ole Madsen at +45 2680 6903. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Senior Recruiter, NER, Lars Mørch at +45 2780 8530.  Please apply at your earliest convenience. We do not have an application deadline but accept applications if the job is posted. The position will be closed once we have found the right candidate. Date Posted: 31-05-2022 Industry: Financial Services Job area: Product Location: Klausdalsbrovej 601, 2750, Ballerup, Denmark Language: English (US) Type: Full-time Experience: Mid-Senior Level Company Description Handling billions of transactions annually, Nets is among the top payment processors in Europe. We keep a tight focus on making it even easier and more intuitive for our customers to handle digital payments and related services. This has made us a trusted partner to more than 700,000 merchant outlets, including 140,000 online merchant outlets, more than 260,000 enterprises and over 250 banks across Europe. Changing the future of payments takes strong personalities At Nets, you’ll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Working to change the future of payments, it’s not just skills and ambition that gets the job done, it’s the full package that makes the difference. Together, we impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business and colleague. What powers you at work? Job Description Passion for and experience in data and/or usability? At Nets Merchant Services, we are going all-in to establish agile best practices around product development and portfolio management. The key to that transformation will be to provide insights and metrics on how our products and portfolio perform in the market and anchor those insights with the product development team, as well as upper management, to ensure that they drive concrete actions that help steer our products to be customer-focused and competitive. As a Data Engineer, you will be part of an international team of 12 data professionals, counting data engineers, data scientists, product owners and business analysts. You will work together as an agile team, to provide insights-as-a-product, both for internal customers, as well as external customers. You will be working with colleagues across Europe, and in a context where the organisation fully supports the blending of technical and business skills. Our company structure allows you to build your own career and grow in a business that encompasses all aspects of the digital payment value chain. This role can be based in our offices in Denmark or Finland. In this role, you’ll power an easier tomorrow for all of us You’re expected to develop your talent and aim higher as you work to change payments. You’ll build on our proven track record of developing and delivering innovative and reliable solutions and our strengths as a Nordic leader with 50 years of experience within payment solutions. Your key task and responsibilities are:      To establish data flows, both based on batch and real-time frameworks.          To transform large data sets based on Spark/Scala.          To enable robust and scalable integration and provision of data towards customer channels.          To work in a truly agile team setting, with DevOps practices, fixed cadence, continuous learning, dedicated product ownership and customer focus.          To follow product development from MVP to full-fledged operational solutions     Qualifications You contribute with skills, ambitions and that little personal twist that makes us succeed It’s the full package that you bring to work every day that gets the job done. Your professional acumen and experience form most of your qualifications, but it’s your personality that makes the difference to succeed in this role. Especially the little twists we all have that makes our personalities instead of just a person. (Potentially add more to the engaging introduction to the person we are looking for) Your professional qualifications include:      Bachelor’s degree or higher in relevant education i.e. Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar          Minimum 1-2 years of experience with Data Engineering. Nice to have Data warehouse and BI knowledge.          Good knowledge and experience on ETL tools, Databricks/Spark, SQL, Python, Scala, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, or similar tools/technologies          Experience with real-time streaming technologies like Kafka, and Rabbit MQ          Experience with midrange technologies like Linux and RDBMS is an added advantage          General knowledge of Data management, ETL, Scheduling and Data Quality principles          Experience working with Azure, AWS, or other cloud providers          Agile mindset and experience of Scrum          DevOps and CI/CD focus     Good to have:      Experience from Fintech industry is preferred          Experience with data visualization using Power BI or any other tool will be a plus          Knowledge of Data Mesh Architecture or similar patterns in the field          Domain driven design architecture/principles     Additional Information Apply with your CV, and if you want, you can attach a short video clip in the SmartProfile. If you’re curious to learn more about the job, you’re welcome to contact Claus Pedersen - caped@nets.eu You can meet more of our personalities by visiting our careers page:https://www.nets.eu/careers/employees/Pages/default.aspx We conduct background checks on relevant candidates through our partner Semac, www.semac.no.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 23 days ago

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeTemporaryFull Job Description   Bluelight Consulting is a leading software consultancy seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join our fast-growing team. Our mission is to design and develop technology that improves the lives of its users while providing an exceptionally high level of service to our clients.   We are looking for Data Engineer who wants to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s opinions and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work.   Our team is distributed across the United State and Central / South America. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and creating the finest apps in the marketplace, please apply below.  What We Are Looking For Experience with AWS services including but not limited to S3, Athena, EC2, EMR, and Glue. Ability to solve any ongoing issues with operating the cluster. Experience with the integration of data from multiple data sources. Experience with various database technologies such as SQLServer, Redshift, Postgres, and RDS. Experience with one or more of the following data integration platforms: Pentaho Kettle, SnapLogic, Talend OpenStudio, Jitterbit, Informatica PowerCenter, or similar. Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service. Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service. Experience with collecting/managing/reporting on large data stores. Awareness of Data governance and data quality principles. Well versed in Business Analytics including basic metric building and troubleshooting. Understand Integration architecture: application integration and data flow diagrams, source-to-target mappings, data dictionary reports. Familiar with Web Services: XML, REST, SOAP. Experience with Git or similar version control software. Experience with integrations with and/or use of BI tools such as GoodData (Prefered), Tableau, PowerBI, or similar. Broad experience with multiple RDBMS: MS SQLServer, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift. Familiarity with SaaS/cloud data systems (e.g. Salesforce). Data warehouse design: star-schemas, change data capture, denormalization. SQL/DDL queries/Tuning techniques such as indexing, sorting, and distribution. BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field. 3+ years of Data Pipeline development such as SnapLogic or Datastage, Informatica, or related experience. 3+ years of SQL experience (No-SQL experience is a plus). Experience designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines.What You'll Be Doing Develop and maintain data models for core package application and reporting databases to describe objects and fields for support documentation and to facilitate custom application development and data integration. Monitoring execution and performance of daily pipelines, triage and escalate any issues. Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models and data pipelines that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization. Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes. Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work. Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data-related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues. Work within AWS/Linux cloud systems environment in support of data integration solution Works closely with a team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts. Teamwork: Collaborate with team members. Share knowledge, provide visibility of interpersonal accomplishments and follow directions when provided.Company Benefits Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases Generous paid-time-off policy Technology / Office stipend 100% remote work, now and post COVID Continuing education, training, conferences Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications   Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.   You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!   So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote  Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeTemporaryFull Job DescriptionWell Engineer Drilling Would you like to provide integrated solutions that maximize the value for our customers? Do you enjoy being part of a team that keeps our energy business moving? Join our IWS team! The Integrated Well Services business offers scalable solutions that maximize the value of an operator’s assets through project management, well engineering, field supervision, risk management and contractor management. Focused on service delivery and operational excellence with safe and cost-effective outcomes, IWS leverages technology solutions, digital platforms and Baker Hughes’ global footprint. Partner with the best The IWS Well Engineer - Drilling will provide technical input to the well construction, completions, well intervention and abandonment phases, from the concept and tendering stage through project commencement, execution and project close out. The WE ensures the well design and well program is prepared and detailed procedures are provided to the execution team; the WE is a key contributor during project execution providing follow up, technical input, and operational support. As a Well Engineer Drilling, you will be responsible for: Preparing of well design, well plan and operational procedures for construction, completion, intervention and/or abandonment of wells in area of responsibility. Define technical services and third-party requirements. Prepare operational time and well cost estimates. Collaborating with internal and external parties, prepare risk register and contingency plans. Prepare, participate and lead peer reviews, peer assists, and other quality assurance activities related to the project. Providing engineering recommendations and advice to the project team. Evaluate and implement best practices and technological advancements to IWS operations. Monitor technical and operations KPIs and benchmark against offset well data and pre-defined well objectives. Prepare all technical reports related to the project including End of Well Report, after action reviews, lessons learned summary. Ensuring that pre-defined technical and operations KPIs are monitored and benchmarked against offset well data and pre-defined well objectives. Ensuring all engineering activities are in line with HSE policies and procedures, and HSE culture by setting example through safe work practices. Conducting business according to Baker Hughes Culture Pillars, Participate in tender bid preparation process for well engineering input. Deliver customer presentations & lead meetings (may include travel to other locations). Fuel your passion To be successful in this role you will have: Bachelor's degree preferably in Petroleum Engineering or Mechanical/Chemical Engineering with MS in Petroleum/Oil & Gas or Well Engineering. 8+ years of relevant work experience in well construction, drilling Operation and optimization. Competences should include engineering simulations, field operations, preparation of integrated drilling programs, well planning, casing design. Well control and geomechanics knowledge. Record of accomplishment of continuous improvement and optimization of designs and operations. Excellent interpersonal skills to work well with colleagues across all businesses/cultures, achieve objectives through effective influencing, and establish credibility with senior leaders. Excellent analytics and problem-solving, including ability to form hypotheses and move forward in the absence of complete information. Excellent English oral and written communication skills, including ability to synthesize complex topics into clear and simple messages. MS office suite, power BI or other analytical tools, well engineering and design software (for example: hydraulics, torque and drag, casing design) Basic knowledge/exposure to specific applications: conventional rotary drilling, horizontal and/or re-entry wells, pad drilling. Well Control awareness About Us:   With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. Summary: Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.  Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM and Non OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets. Job Description: Customer Support Engineer is responsible for problem resolution for our customers related to gas turbines, steam turbines, generators and relevant auxiliaries.  Being part of multi-disciplinary engineering team, it will be expected to have flexibility to learn gas turbine, steam turbine, and generator operational aspects in addition to primary job responsibilities. The RoleWhere you fit in Rashpetco/Burullus is a Joint Venture (JV) company operating one of Egypt’s largest gas fields. The JV is the operator of the WDDM (West Delta Deep Marine) Field, which includes offshore wells/platforms and the 2.3 BCFD gas treatment plant located at Idku (Egypt North Coast). WDDM production supplying gas to the National Grid for internal use, and to the adjacent “Egypt LNG” plant for LNG export. Shell is a major partner in both Rashpetco and ELNG. The current WDDM field and facilities is currently producing around 500 MMSCFD of gas & approx. 10,000 BPD of condensate. It also processes 3rd party gas from adjacent fields, and as such has a privileged position to support Egypt’s strategy to become a gas hub in the Mediterranean region. In order to manage field decline, Rashpetco is currently completing the Phase 9b development. It has also embarked on an ambitious exploration effort, currently drilling it deepest ever well. Current success factors for Rashpetco include, i) controlling of late-life short-term unit operating costs, ii) maintaining and strengthening license to operate through effective management of HSE and Asset Integrity, thereby providing a solid plate-form to support the in-country growth aspiration What’s the role? Design/asset optimisation activities concentrate on routine topics (guided by procedures or multiple precedents). Has greater exposure to process integration, as the job holder needs to integrate a wider range of disciplines when undertaking design activities for projects. Works as an autonomous Process Engineer, translates the guidelines and standards into practice and solves common technical challenges. Works within company standards and policies under defined directions while receiving occasional guidance on techniques. Makes recommendations and improvements to existing processes. Carries out peer reviews and supports JG5s Ensures integration of related discipline activities to achieve delivery which is safe (all aspects of HSSE - personal/process safety and environment), fit for purpose and meeting cost-value optimisation. Performs tasks within design, operation, or maintenance of facilities/plant, interfacing with external stakeholders and managing contractors. Can be responsible for a budget (depending on role requirement). Independently manages the relation with multiple (groups of) internal and external stakeholders on a tactical level. What we need from you Profession in process engineering modeling for both oil and gas upstream Able to perform flare, PSVs, blowdown calculation and models Perform process equipment sizing such as compressors, vessels / separators ...etc Fully aware of applying international codes and standards related to process engineering Able to manage the interfaces with site operations team for issues related to production, deferment, and quality Managing the interfaces with the engineering team with different backgrounds and technical authorities Have a proven experience of developing facilities capacity limits taking into consideration different operating and design factors Full information and experience in process safety studies, such as HAID, HAZOP, SIL, QRA..etc Full awareness of Management of Change (MoC) and the needed steps to build an acceptable process to ensure tolerable risk is being managed Fully aware of ALARP demonstration and the role of the process engineering to ensure ALARP is being maintained Generating technical notes and engineering reports covering process engineering work as well as other engineering aspects that related to the job able to coach local talents Company Description At Shell Egypt, we believe that people are our greatest asset. You will see that our commitment to your career reflects our drive to innovate on many levels. We are committed to supply the world’s need for energy in socially and environmentally responsible ways and our commitment to diversity will always be of paramount importance. Shell began operations in Egypt in 1911 and has been a steady presence and employer ever since. In addition, our social investment and development programmes attest to our commitment to make a difference for Egypt’s youth. Shell Egypt runs workshop-based sessions aimed at delivering today's practical business skills to students through lectures and training conducted by experienced Shell hires, such as the “Step Towards Progress” (STP) at Cairo University; the “Annual Conference for Engineering Students” (ACES) & the “Give and Gain” programme at Ain Shams University, the “Real Life Project” at the American University of Cairo and the “Al Amal Programme” (Hope Programme). An innovative place to work There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part. An inclusive place to work To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential. We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there. We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology. We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application. A rewarding place to work Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice. We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.Disclaimer     Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Our engineers and data scientists transform data into machine learning based product features to help developers find the right audiences for their games. You will work with teams based in Montreal and Helsinki to define and implement the data infrastructure and pipelines feeding deep neural network models. Our team is experiencing fast growth and expanding to new areas of business. Your main tasks as our Data engineer will be full stack web development with Microsoft stack (C#) where front end skills on various technologies are valued. The vacancy is full time and permanent in Tampere, Finland. Your role Each Sandvik product creates tremendous amounts of data for our experts to analyze and to refine. Our customers are external clients and internal stakeholders. We value commitment and interest in continuous integration practices. Your main responsibilities as our new midlevel/senior Data engineer will be full stack web development with Microsoft stack (C#). Good to see you here, Dev! As you probably figured, we are looking for reinforcements to join our team. We are seeking specifically people with a passion for code and the curiosity to understand how the world works in order to find the meaning in all we do. It's definitely an asset to have a profound competence in some of the technologies we are using – or going to use. We do need people that can extend our skillset right from the beginning. But since passion and curiosity always beat skills over time, that is not the primary thing we're looking for. Our product is a wide combination of design, psychology, data acquisition, data processing, data analysis, web and mobile interfaces, various databases, cloud servers, and APIs. In the end, it's a negotiation AI that handles conversations better than human beings. To work, the system must have the best possible data available and the capabilities to figure out the next move and to generate the natural language to communicate it. Sounds like a challenge you're up for? As a Data Engineer, you are going to... Be an essential part of our Data team that is responsible for extending our database with new, relevant features and monitoring their quality.Be solving problems with Python and using different kinds of APIs and databases.Be writing web crawlers and data processing algorithms.Actively participate in data design.Apply Clean Code principles, test your code, and review others' code This means that you'll need to have good skills on... PythonREST APIsSQL (PostgreSQL) It would definitely be of help to also... Know KafkaHave experience in cloud servers (Google Cloud). What are we exactly looking for? Most likely, you have spent many years playing (i.e. trying things) with computers and done many projects either at work or in your free time. You have countless times felt the pain of banging your head on nasty problems, but you also yearn for the feeling of coming through as a winner. You know that StackOverflow has all the answers, but you have spent so many hours googling for the basic bugs that you don't get stuck on them anymore – at least daily. You have an "anything is possible – time is the only concern" kind of attitude. When you join us, you are going to be trusted – probably more than you'd ever expected. We are a small, fast-learning team that you can lean on and spar with, but who also expects you to look for the answers and bring solutions to the table. We trust that every one of us is actively looking for ways to make our system better, to make our customers happier, and we believe that every one of us can discover the next big idea that takes us forward. We are, above all, honest and respectful. You'll get the best tools you need and a fair salary. We do believe that physical presence plays a significant role in culture-building and effortless communication, but once you've worked with us some time, part-remote work is a way of doing your thing.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

“As our new Microsoft 365 Engineer, you will have a key role in developing and coding our internal Azure platform. It’s still in the early stages, so there are great opportunities for you to make an impact. We want our people to grow, so you will have a high level of autonomy on your tasks.” Says Infrastructure Manager, Kenneth Borup Alstrup Together with seven excellent and supportive colleagues in Infrastructure and Operations, you’ll be responsible for Dustin’s Cloud transformation. The team works in 14-day sprints based on Scrum. This allows you to have a very high level of autonomy in your projects and have the full team’s support when needed. Who will thrive in this role? You will thrive and be successful in this role if you get excited about this: A high level of personal and professional development A “Win as a team” culture, where we lift as a team and care about each otherFreedom to work when and where it fits you – as long as you deliver on your tasksA personal budget for relevant trainingO365/EXO PowerShell, MDM tools, Exchange Online and email/security administration Still curious? Read more on our career page About the position Every 14-day sprint is kicked off with a 2-hour meeting, where you and your colleagues plan the next 14 days in the team. This provides you with influence over your tasks and work plan, as well as a clear direction and clear expectations. From there, you structure your days independently, and you can always reach out to your manager or colleagues for sparring. Typically, you are given responsibility to work on a variety of projects within our Microsoft 365 setup such as assessments, planning, design, testing, security and technical documentation, implementation, and support. Among other things, you will also: Implement and document existing and future state architecture Monitor and analyse unified audit logs, security dashboards, SIEM and managed appliancesTroubleshoot and solve advanced and complex issues as they ariseWork closely with administrators, engineers, vendors, and users Optimise and automate manual processes in O365 and EXO Powershell You are given continuous opportunities for development and will have an excellent and knowledgeable team around you. They all strive for a friendly and supportive culture and enjoy sharing their knowledge, reaching common goals, and having fun on Friday fikas with Scribble and an after-work beer. What you bring We want to make sure we hire the right person, who will thrive in Dustin. Our employees’ well-being and development is important. Therefore, we are looking for you who has: In-depth understanding of the Implementation and administration processes to support the Office 365 suite of products (Azure AD, O365 Groups, Office.com, Teams etc.)Understanding of MDM tools (Intune, Azure Identity and Rights Management, Enterprise Mobility Suite)Experience with Exchange Online to include OME & S/MIME Encryption, DKIM, DMARC and SPF conceptsE-mail and security administration, phishing and credential harvesting campaigns, mitigation and collaboration with users and required teams to perform remediation We believe our colleagues are the key reason for our positive development. And we believe our development is what gives you the possibility to grow. That is why we can promise you one thing: You keep us moving. We keep you moving. Recruitment Process We want a good match! For this process we expect to conduct an initial telephone checkup, an online first interview, a cognitive test and an online technical interview. This ensures we find the right person for the right role based on a fair data driven basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Janni Wissing Nielsen by email: janni.wissingnielsen@dustin.dk We will screen and evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis and close the job ad when we have found the right person for the role. We encourage you to send your motivated application and resume in English as soon as possible.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 3 days ago

Entreprise    Inventeur il y a 70 ans du concept de club de vacances, l’ambition du Club Med est de conserver sa place de pionner dans ce domaine et d’être reconnu comme le leader mondial des vacances tout compris, haut de gamme, conviviales et multiculturelles. Présent dans 26 pays, il compte plus de 70 Villages répartis sur cinq continents. Terrain d'apprentissage reconnu à l’international et par de nombreuses écoles de haut niveau, le siège du Club Med offre l’opportunité de se révéler professionnellement dans des fonctions supports variées : RH, Juridique, Gestion, Marketing, Communication, etc.    Contexte de la missions    Au sein de la Direction Global Marketing Digital Technologie Club Med, vous ferez partie des équipes Customer & Business Intelligence et serez rattaché(e) au Customer Domain Manager. Accompagné(e) par un(e) Data Engineer Senior, vous participerez à la transformation Data du Club Med.    Ce projet multidimensionnel a pour objectif de délivrer de la Valeur Business, d'augmenter les capacités data & IA, et d'encourager l’innovation via différents moyens :      Construction d’une architecture data modulable dans un environnement cloud        Création d’un Data Excellence Center pour réunir dans une même dynamique les talents business, data & IT      Missions    Alimentation de la Data Factory dans un environnement GCP :  Développer les différents flux d’alimentation de la Data Factory sous GCP (real time, batch, API), Concevoir et mettre en œuvre les pipelines et entrepôts de données structurées et non structurées, Assurer la qualité des données collectées, préparer et optimiser le stockage et le chargement, Assurer et améliorer le monitoring des différents flux déjà existants en mettant en place des processus d’automatisation et d’industrialisation Participer à la mise en place d’une chaine d’intégration continue (CI/CD) en collaboration avec les DevOps et l’équipe technique du Club Med   Exploitation des data disponibles dans la Data Factory :  Contribuer à la collecte des besoins utilisateurs et à la définition d’une vision Produit, Collaborer avec les Data Analyst à l’automatisation des requêtes et d’analyses pour des besoins métiers, Diffuser les données pré calculées via les API de la Data factory vers les différentes applications du Club Med, Maintenir en condition opérationnelle des modèles existants de Machine Learning (tensorflow, keras) Définir des KPIs et créer des tableaux de bord de coût et d’utilisation Assurer le Cataloging des données au sein de la plateforme   Veille technologique et stratégique :  Réaliser des POC sur des solutions innovantes du marché Partager en interne les innovations sur GCP et en Open Source   Profil    Compétences requises :      Formation Bac +5 en école d’ingénieur/université spécialisée en Informatique et Gestion de la donnée et de la Data Science        Vous avez connaissance de l’écosystème Cloud GCP (Bigquery, Cloud functions, Cloud Storage, Pub Sub), la certification GCP est un plus souhaitable        Vous avez la conviction que la donnée à toute son importance, et pensez qu’elle est à mettre en regard des besoins métiers        Vous aimez la donnée et êtes pragmatique        Vous avez le sens de l’écoute et aimez partager        Les sujets technologiques vous passionnent, vous êtes à l’aise pour conseiller voire challenger les demandes de vos clients internes      Compétences souhaitées :      Vous avez connaissance des technologies Big Data telles que Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Java, Python et API        Vous avez des capacités d’industrialisation, de monitoring et d’orchestration : Kubernetes, Airflow, Jenkins, Opcon est un plus        Vous êtes curieux, rigoureux et aimez les challenges        Vous avez développé des programmes d’automatisation de pipeline de Machine Learning et de livraison en continue        Vous avez des capacités de construction de data visualisation, démontrées sur 1 outil au moins (Kibana, Datastudio, Qliksense, etc.)        Vous connaissez un ou plusieurs outils de cataloging et de data lineage (Dbt, Collibra,etc.)     Modalités    Poste CDI    Basé au siège du Groupe Club Med à Paris, La Villette (19ème)    Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap Hiring InsightsJob Position Description:En rejoignant CGI, entreprise canadienne et leader mondial du conseil et des services numériques, vous serez au cœur de la transformation digitale des entreprises et de la société. Intelligence artificielle, blockchain, cybersecurité, transformation des modèles économiques, autant d’enjeux qui rythmeront votre quotidien aux côtés de nos professionnels  Vous cherchez à intervenir pour des sociétés Data Driven, vous êtes intéressé par la Business Intelligence, le Big Data, les approches Cloud, en étant impliqué dans les problématiques métiers et cas d’usages.   Vous avez envie de relever des challenges sur de l’intégration de données (data warehouse, datalake), sur la data vizualisation mais aussi sur des applications cloud (Spark / Databricks, Kafka, Microsoft Azure, Snowflake …) et dans des contextes Agile et innovants. Your future duties and responsibilities:Venez rejoindre nos équipes de Data Engineer. Vos interventions consisteront à concevoir des solutions performantes et à livrer des « produits » en itérations courtes.   Vous aurez en charge de développer les besoins business (intégration de données, conception de rapports, automatisation, …), de tester la solution, et de la déployer.   Accompagné et entouré par une communauté Data, vous pouvez échanger, partager et vous former selon vos inspirations et votre créativité. Cela vous permet d’être force de proposition en interne et auprès de nos clients.  La proximité, le suivi personnalisé de votre manager et un bon nombre d’événements tout au long de l'année renforcent la convivialité et notre esprit d'équipe !Required qualifications to be successful in this role:   Vous correspondez à ce poste si vous avez une formation Bac+3/5 en informatique et au minimum 2 ans d’expériences dans ce domaine.     Si vous êtes passionné du monde de la data, que vous faites preuve de curiosité intellectuelle et que vous appréciez le travail en équipe, vous êtes le candidat idéal.     Vous maitrisez tout ou partie des compétences suivantes : SQL, développement ETL, reporting, Spark, la stack Microsoft Azure, les languages comme Python ou Scala mais aussi les concepts de modélisation de la donnée et de BigData     Compétences Data Engineer :   Oracle / SQL Outils reporting (Microstrategy, PowerBI, Cognos, Tableau, …)ETL (Datastage, PowerCenter, talend, , …)Python / R AnglaisEsprit d’équipe  Les + de CGI :   Le développement des compétences : Le groupe CGI est très soucieux de l’épanouissement de ses membres. Pour cela, elle met tout en œuvre dans des actions de développements des compétences et connaissances de ses membres. Une vaste gamme de formations est disponible pour les membres.    L’ambiance : L’agence de Clermont-Ferrand organise bon nombre d’événements conviviaux tout au long de l’année pour renforcer la convivialité et l’esprit d’équipe.   Les avantages supplémentaires : Jours de congés supplémentaires, remboursements des titres transports en commun à hauteur de 100%, prêt patronal, ne sont qu’un aperçu des avantages dont peuvent bénéficier les membres !    Parce que la réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et l’engagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture d’actionnaire-propriétaire, ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.  Skills:Data EngineeringWhat you can expect from us:Allier savoir et faire  Alors que la technologie s’inscrit au cœur de la transformation numérique de nos clients, nous savons que les individus sont au cœur du succès en affaires.   Lorsque vous rejoignez CGI, vous devenez un conseiller de confiance, collaborant avec vos collègues et clients pour proposer des idées exploitables qui produisent des résultats concrets et durables. Nous appelons nos employés "membres" parce qu’ils sont actionnaires et propriétaires de CGI. Ils ont du plaisir à travailler et à grandir ensemble pour bâtir une entreprise dont nous sommes fiers. C’est notre rêve depuis 1976. Il nous a menés là où nous sommes aujourd’hui – l’une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.  Chez CGI, nous reconnaissons la richesse que la diversité nous apporte. Nous aspirons à créer une culture à laquelle nous appartenons tous et collaborons avec nos clients pour créer des communautés plus inclusives. En tant qu’employeur qui prône l’égalité des chances pour tous, nous voulons donner à tous nos membres les moyens de réussir et de s’épanouir. Si vous avez besoin d’un accompagnement spécifique durant le processus de recrutement et d’intégration, veuillez nous en informer. Nous serons heureux de vous aider.   Prêt à faire partie d’une entreprise qui est gage d’excellence? Rejoignez CGI – où vos idées et vos actions changent la donne.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

job_title: Data Engineer (full time, all seniority levels) - QuantumBla...
job_description: Who You'll Work WithBased in Paris and working across the region, as a consultant data engineer you will work closely with our clients, data scientists and all types of McKinsey consultants to curate problem specific datasets that feed directly into our machine learning and modelling approach. This hybrid client-facing/technical role will allow you to use state of the art technologies to solve highly impactful business problems, whilst also leveraging your strong communication skills to convey complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences. Who you are This position is for a data engineer (all seniority levels) with strong intrinsic technical ability and an aptitude to solving complex problems using technology. A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritising impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here – you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.What You'll DoAs a Data Engineer with the Paris office... You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance. See our video: A Day in the Life of a Data Engineer Role responsibilities Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches Acquire, ingest, and process data from multiple sources and systems into Big Data platforms Understanding, assessing and mapping the data landscape. Maintaining our Information Security standards on the engagement. Collaborate with our data scientists to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in their advanced analytical models. Defining the technology stack to be provisioned by our infrastructure team. Building modular pipeline to construct features and modelling tables. Use new and creative techniques to deliver impact for our clients as well as internal R&D projects. What you’ll learn No project is ever the same – we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities across the region. How successful projects on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end pipelines. Build products alongside the Core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations. Be focused on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data by working alongside the Data Science team which focuses on modelling the data. Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment. You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport. Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally. Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels. Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance. Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions. Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life. Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 car’s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture: Healthcare Efficiency – We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches. Environmental Impact – We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution. Product Development – We worked with the CEO of an elite automotive organisation to reduce the 18-month car development timeframe by improving processes, designs and team structures. Please note that the recruiting process for this role can take up to 5 weeks, together with the necessary preparation - we advise you to take this into consideration when thinking about the timing of your application.QualificationsMaster’s degree in quantitative field like computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics or related field required; advanced degree advantageous Experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python, Scala, or similar languages Familiarity with the latest OSS, cloud, container, query languages and database technologies Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Commercial client-facing or senior stakeholder management experience a plus Fluency in both English and French Willingness to travel up to 60%Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

At Heaviside we partner with organizations to design data-augmented strategies, engineer pragmatic technologies and delivering impactful use-cases that enlighten real-world problem. We step-function business by inventing their future way of working. We do this by designing data-augmented strategies, engineering pragmatic technologies and delivering impactful use-cases that enlighten real-world problems. All roles at Heaviside involve business and technical development pathways which aim at facilitating your career growth. We aspire to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career which will have a greater impact.  As a Data Engineer at Heaviside, you will be joining a small team responsible for the data systems that power everything we do for our clients. It can cover both strategy and business planning as well as cutting-edge behavioral research and organizational analytics. You will be responsible for the end-to-end implementation of the data stack from collection to reporting, with a focus on infrastructure and technical processes. You will be working with Data Consultants and support them in tackling their clients' data challenges. You will contribute to the definition of data strategies, the implemention of data systems, and you will support the leverage of data into transformational projects. In general, you will be responsible for understanding problems intimately, crafting a technical strategy to address them, and facilitating high-quality technical execution.  Responsibilities Data Unifier: Architect, assemble, assimilate, clean, and conform large, complex datasets to deliver business insights and power data product experiences Data Security Agent: Design and build reliable, scalable data infrastructure with leading privacy and security techniques to safeguard data Data Ops: Own the end-to-end data stack including event collection, data governance, data integrations, and modeling Data Custodian: Ensure consistency and quality of the technical environment and data structure through metrics, documentation, processes, data testing, and training  If you have some or all of the following please apply Knowledgeable in Cloud Data Warehouse services. Experience in Google BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS Redshift/Athena, Looker, Azure SQL DWH or Azure Databricks is highly desirable Knowledgeable in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modelling, data optimisation and data analysis techniques Experience in building end to end data pipelines using on-premise or cloud-based data platforms Experience with hands-on delivery of solutions which include databases, advanced SQL and software development in languages such as Python Interested and knowledgeable in Big Data technologies and Apache ecosystem technologies such as Beam, Spark, Kafka, Airflow, databases, integration, master data management, quality assurance, data wrangling and data governance technologies Experienced with public cloud platforms and cloud infrastructure, which is essential Exposed to ETL/ELT and governance tools Interested in AI and ML technologies and principles Able to migrate and transform large, complex datasets from diverse sources, structures and formats, modeled to support analysis for access to quality actionable insights You are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver with thought leadership and commercial awareness You are fully fluent in French and English (the position is based in Paris)  Benefits At Heaviside, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts by providing benefits that allow our employees: You will benefit from a competitive package based on your experience with opportunity for advancement We are committed to make you grow and become the best version of yourself as part of a world-class team with bright and passionate people. Heaviside will strongly invest in your development through on-going training and personalized skills development path We value initiative and are always happy to subvention team building activities or any kind of insightful training There is no subject matter expert at Heaviside, even if our consultants start their track with a strategic/business or tech “color”, they are expected to build or strengthen their expertise or consulting approach during client assignments Our HR and Staffing team is closely following each individual in order to make everyone the best version of himself  Inclusion & Diversity The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfill our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Heaviside.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

job_description: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePermanentIndeed's salary guideNot provided by employer$27.7K - $35.1K a year is Indeed's estimated salary for this role in Niort, NA. Full Job DescriptionIntitulé du poste      Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer - NIORT ou PARIS F/H    Type de contrat      Contrat à durée indéterminée    Temps de travail      Plein temps    Description      Nous recherchons un Data scientist/Machine Learning Engineer          Ce poste, basé à Niort, est à pourvoir en CDI dès que possible.      Au sein de la Tribu Intelligence Artificielle et Data Opérationnelle de la Datafactory MAIF, vous êtes acteurs du développement de nos solutions Data IA Scoring     Vous rejoignez une organisation agile, composée d’un équipage d’une dizaine de Data Scientists, mais aussi de Lead Dev, Data Analyste, Data Stewart, …     Vos Missions     Vous contribuez aux développements et à la maintenance des produits API & batch de la squad score : Scoring d’appétence, estimation valeur mobilière, explicabilité d’évolution de tarif, provisionnement, ... Vous veillez à la qualité de votre code, à la pertinence de l’architecture fonctionnelle des produits. Vous êtes impliqués sur nos travaux innovations notamment sur la partie MLOPS.    Vous contribuez à notre veille permanente sur les pratiques et technos : Features stores, versionning modèles, monitoring des modèles, pipeline de réentrainement... Vous êtes acteur de la Singularité DATA : Ethique et intérêt collectif sont au cœur de notre action, avec notamment des initiatives open source telles que Shapash et Eurybia auxquelles vous contribuez. Environnement technique : Python, Github, OpenShift, Jenkins, fastapi, serveurs GPU     Profil / Qualifications      Diplômé(e) d’un Bac+5 en école d’ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire     Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 2 ans minimum en tant ML Engineer / Data Scientist et avez mis en production des modèles / API Vous avez une forte appétence pour les développements informatiques, vous avez le souci de la propreté et de la qualité de votre code. Vous êtes familier de bonnes pratiques de développement (lint, tests, … ) Vous avez mis en œuvre plusieurs pratiques MLOPS Maitrise de Python, Github, Openshift, CI / CD     Vous aimez partager et échanger sur toute problématique liée au Machine Learning Vous avez également un très bon esprit d’équipe et vous maîtrisez l’application des principes Agile. Soft Skills: – Autonomie      – Organisation      – Curiosité      – Bonne pédagogie / Capacité de synthèse     Localisation du poste Localisation du poste      Nouvelle-Aquitaine, Deux Sèvres (79)    Lieu      Niort   Informations générales MAIF Acteur majeur de l'assurance en France, MAIF défend une autre idée de l'économie et a développé un modèle mutualiste centré sur l'humain.
