담당 업무 - HE사업본부 데이터 레이크, 데이터 웨어하우스 설계, 디자인, 구축, 문서화, 시스템 최적화 - LG 전자 내 현업 전문가들과 협업하며, 여러 다른 형태의 데이터 (고객, 기업)를 분류하고, 표준화하고, 연결하는 Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) 작업 - AWS, GCP 위에서 돌아갈 빅데이터 기술을 연구, 실험하고 사용 (AWS, Hadoop, Spark 등) - Tableau 등 대시보드에 공급될 데이터 프로세싱, 데이터 파이프라인 개발 - HE사업본부 데이터 거버넌스 체계 구축담당 업무 - LG 전자 내 현업 전문가들과 협업하며, 여러 다른 형태의 데이터 (고객, 기업)를 분석하고 패턴과 인사이트를 추출하여 실제 현업에 가치를 창출 (업무 효율화, 업무 품질 개선 등) - 데이터 기반 의사결정 방법론 구축 (e.g. A/B Testing) - AWS, GCP 등 클라우드 빅데이터 플랫폼 위에서 데이터 마이닝, 분석 모델링 - LG 전자 내 현업 전문가들과 Data & Analytics 사례 발굴, 가능성 검토, 데이터 분석, 모델링, 시각화 및 프로덕트 개발 - Structured & Unstructured data 기반 머신러닝, 자연어처리, 클러스터링, 네트워크 분석 - 통계 / AI / ML 기술을 활용하여 수요 예측, Scoring Model, 추천 시스템, 그로스 해킹1. Data Engineer 필수 지원 조건 - 학위 : 학사 이상 학위소지자 - 전공 : Computer Science, Data Science 유관 전공 - 경력기간 : 3년 이상 데이터 ETL, 엔터프라이즈 데이터 레이크, 데이터 웨어하우스 개발 및 운영 경험 - 소프트웨어 개발 프레임워크 및 개발 방법론 경험 - 클라우드 빅데이터 툴 경험 (Spark, Hive, Redshift, BigQuery 등) - Unix/Linux 환경 경험, SQL, NoSQL 경험 - 엔터프라이즈 스케일의 데이터 인프라 위에서 데이터 파이프라인 및 솔루션을 설계하고 구축한 경험 우대사항 - Ad-hoc, product level Data Analytics 솔루션 개발 경험 - Tableau, MicroStrategy 등 Visualization tool 경험 2. Data Scientist 필수 지원 조건 - 학위 : 학사 이상 학위 소지자 - 전공 : 통계학, 데이터 사이언스, 컴퓨터 사이언스 등 Data Analytics 유관전공 - 경력기간 : 3년이상 Data Analytics 실무 경험 (비즈니스 현업 문제에서 출발하여 Data gathering, cleaning, analysis/modeling, delivery, model management 등) 및 머신러닝/데이터 마이닝 알고리즘에 대한 깊은 이해 - Data integrity, data governance 에 대한 이해 - Python Data & Analytics 라이브러리 경험 (NLTK, Spacy, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch 등) 우대사항 - 통계학, 데이터 사이언스, 컴퓨터 사이언스 등 Data Analytics 유관전공 석사 혹은 박사학위 소지자 - GCP, AWS 등 클라우드 경험 - GIT 등 source code management 경험, Software Development Life Cycle 경험 - SQL, ElasticSearch, Solr, Neo4J 등 데이터베이스 경험 3. 공통사항 - 해외여행에 결격사유가 없는 경우에 한합니다. - 취업보호대상자 (장애인 및 보훈대상자)는 관련 법규에 의거하여 우대합니다.제출방법 : 반드시 LG그룹 채용사이트(careers.lg.com)을 통한 온라인 지원만 가능 ※ 우편접수, e-mail 접수 및 방문접수 불가 문의처 : LG Careers - 채용문의 - 1:1질문하기Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 6 days ago

Job detailsJob TypeTemporaryFull Job DescriptionJob Description IOTG OpenVINO Runtime Engineering team is looking for talented and highly motivated AI frameworks engineer interns. OpenVINO (https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino) is an open-source toolkit for maximizing the performance of deep learning network models on various Intel platforms. You will be working on developing highly optimized software for Intel GPUs, collaborating with global Intel teams. Qualifications Qualifications Good programming and debugging skills with C/C++ on Linux. Good knowledge of data structures and algorithms. Basic understanding of operating systems, system software, and computer architecture. Preferred Qualification Basic knowledge of deep learning technologies. Programming with Python or Shell script. Education Students who are currently pursuing a B.S or M.S/Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Additional Notes You'll be required to work full-time for a year but might have flexibility depending on your circumstances. This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. Inside this Business Group The Internet of Things Group (IOTG) consists of ~4700 dedicated employees across 25 locations across the world. IOTG drives significant growth in the Internet of Things (IoT) market, capitalizing on the inflection and creation of edge computing, leveraging smart, connected devices and artificial intelligence (AI) to enable partners to transform their businesses. IOTG's vision is to lead the industry and enterprises to enhance the way we live and work by making it easier to create exciting, new IoT/edge solutions. IOTG's strategy includes creating unique differentiated silicon to consolidate workloads at the Edge, investing in video and AI inference as the killer app for the Edge, creating new developer tools and ecosystems, and establishing a dedicated vertical consultative sales team to add value to our partners across many verticals. Work Model for this Role This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 18 days ago

Company:  Qualcomm Korea YH    Job Area:  Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Systems Engineering    Qualcomm Overview:    Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in.    General Summary:    Join Qualcomm Technologies QCT Multimedia group and contribute to the Corporate & Industry-wide initiatives for developing data compression algorithms for multimedia services in wireless networks. You will participate in the design, implementation and evaluation of state-of-the-art real-time ultra-low latency hardware data compression codecs. You will work with hardware and software teams to come up with optimal solutions based on feedback from key internal and external customers. Offered positions range from engineer to senior staff level.         Responsibilities:                Contribute to the conception, development, implementation and optimization of new algorithms allowing improved coding efficiency for various data sources and formats.                  Identify research directions and manage development of codec improvements for both lossy and lossless compression methods.                  Manage design trade-offs between compression performance and HW complexity.                  Collaborate with global technology teams to collect and understand compression needs and translate these into codec tool requirements and develop a roadmap of feature enhancements.                  Participate in the design and implementation of the next generation of Snapdragon solutions.                  Collaborate with global technology teams to collect and understand compression needs and translate these into codec tool requirements and develop a roadmap of feature enhancements.                Skills/experience:              Ideal candidate would have the below skills/experience:                Excellent communication skills within cross-functional teams designing complex products                  Industry or academic experience required in one or more of the following areas:                    Digital signal processing, image/video processing, image/video compression or information theory.                      Knowledge of computer architecture and hardware design.                      Record of innovation: publications or granted patents in the areas of data compressions, including video and image coding, digital signal processing, or information theory.                    Proficiency in C++ and/or C programming.                  Knowledge of quantitatively assessing hardware implementation requirements of algorithms preferred.                  Familiarity with high level language for data analysis MATLAB, Mathematica.           Applicants: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to      accommodationsupport     To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.    If you would like more information about this role, please contact      Qualcomm Careers  . Summary      Posted: May 23, 2022            Role Number:       200383085      Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. We have an opportunity for Manufacturing Quality Engineer (MQE) for Camera components in Korea. The MQE is responsible for module component product quality throughout the product life cycle. We invite you to join us on this journey and help us leave the world better than we found it!     Key Qualifications10+ years experience in either Manufacturing or the development of consumer electronicsExperience in metrology and standard manufacturing quality control practicesCreative problem solving experience & good english communication skillsExperience developing process quality plans, supplier quality audits, and driving corrective actions and failure analysis effortsProject management experience and a deep understanding of problem solving tools including design of experiments, root cause analysis, and statistical toolsExpertise in GRR, MSA, GD&T practices, Metrology, DFMEA and tolerance analysisKnowledge of reliability methods and quality sampling methodologiesKnowledge or prior experience working on modules for consumer electronics industry preferredExperience with any of the following: mechanical enclosures, castings, plastic parts, injection molding, tooling, jigs, fixtures, or high volume quality manufacturing engineering (e.g. Automotive, Consumer Electronics, Medical Devices, Etc)Strong communication skills and passion to learn and adapt to a dynamic environmentPrior experience in design/manufacturing of injection molding components with tight tolerances is a plusProficiency in English and KoreanDescription       - Manage IQC, IPQC, OQC and ORT for injection molding and stamping components - Drive quality readiness at the factory for development builds and mass production - Drive all quality issues in development builds to timely closure. Present findings and root cause corrective action report to Execs as needed - Collaborate with design, engineering and safety teams to set appropriate quality control/Inspection/metrology stations on the production line - Conduct periodic reviews of Field/Factory Quality Data with OEM partners - Prepare OK to Ship documentation for new product launch - Create risk assessment and implement plans for new products being developed - Work with product design team on DFM and conduct tolerance analysis studies to suggest changes to meet specifications and process capability - Develop and drive execution of module reliability testing plan during NPIs and MP - Support/Attend new product development builds as required - 25% International Travel is required      Education & Experience       - BSME (MS preferred) or equivalent in Mechanical Engineering Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. job_title: Data Center CE Field Service Engineer
job_description: Business Function Overview:  In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a CO+I CE Field Services Engineer (FSE).  Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I FSE, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.  Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action!  Responsibilities   As a successful CO+I CE Field Services Engineer, your success will be measured by:  Data Center Operations  Ensures compliance with data center business units and service-level policies. Engages with appropriate teams and resources to execute tasks or projects. Manages programs associated with area of responsibility. Demonstrates conscientiousness on cost adheres to budget requirements; keeps costs reasonable and contributes to staying within budget. Follows and adheres to safety and security policies and procedures. Reports immediately any safety or security issues or concerns. Participates in Root Cause Analysis (RCA) process as appropriate.   Service Delivery  Maximize Critical Environment (CE) availability in conjunction with our landlord partners at our leased Datacenters and to ensure optimal operational efficiency Oversee the day-to-day operations and maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment in our leased Datacenters (MOP/SOP/EOP review, RCAs, FMEAs, change governance, and risk mitigation) Reduce high-impact and human-error Critical Environment (CE) incidents year over year Deliver on cost/energy efficiency initiativesSupport delivery of the Datacenter’s Emergency Preparedness and Response plans and act as an escalation point for all facilities-related issues within our leased datacenters Coordinate, plan, schedule, and supervise CE audits and compliance verification as needed Ensure routine reporting to effectively manage and analyze our Power/Temperature/Relative Humidity, and SLA monitoring Establish and enhance strong working relationships and engagement with our Engineering Groups (EGs), and Landlord partners (including contributing to MBRs, QBRs) Work with regional and global peers to share and build best practices across the entire datacenter portfolio   Data Center Work Environment  Shares best practices; assists others in learning role, process, procedures. Provides mentorship across data centers for specific expertise. Seeks training opportunities that meet the interest of the business as well as own career goals and objectives. Suggests ways for reducing risk of performing maintenance; works with others to accommodate scheduling needs. Suggests improvements in implementation based on depth of understanding. Contributes to a positive team environment by learning and adopting best practices. Contributes constructively during team meetings and in cross-disciplinary collaborations within the service team.   Ownership  In alignment with management priorities, holds self-accountable for the end-to-end service quality, completeness, and resulting customer experience (including but not limited to availability, safety, security, customer service). Supports escalation of issues to appropriate owner. Qualifications   Microsoft reviews all applications that meet the below Qualifications:  For this role, you are welcome to apply if you meet the following Required Qualifications:  High School Diploma or equivalent AND 2+ year(s) industry experience in a datacenter or other critical environment facility,    OR 3+ years industry experience and college course work.   While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:  3+ years’ experience in Critical Environment infrastructures (e.g., UPS, Generator, AHU) or IT infrastructures (e.g., Servers, SANs, Networking, Capacity, DC Rack/Enclosures, structured cabling). Bachelor’s Degree or Technical College certification in mechanical or electrical engineering and/or services. Experience working on large scale CE projects. Experience with the operation of IT infrastructure (Servers, SANs, Networking, etc.).   Background Check Requirements:  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:  Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.   #COICareers  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 15 days ago

합류하게 될 팀에 대해 알려드려요토스의 Data Engineer (Kafka)는 Data Platform팀에 속해 있어요.Data Platform팀은 Data Division에 속해 있는데요, 토스의 모든 서비스들에서 필요로 하는 데이터와 관련 플랫폼들을 운영하고 지원하고 있어요.Data Platform팀은 2~18년 경력을 가진 멤버들로 구성되어 있고, 포털/은행/게임/스타트업 등 다양한 백그라운드를 갖고 있어요.Data Platform팀에서는 직군에 국한되지 않고 본인의 흥미와 의지가 있다면 다른 업무도 얼마든지 지원이 가능하구요, 기술이나 노하우에 대해서도 자유롭게 공유하는 분위기예요.합류하면 함께 할 업무에요주로 온프레미스 환경에서 Kafka 클러스터를 운영하고, Kafka 를 이용하고자 하는 개발자 분들을 지원해요(일부 클라우드 환경(AWS)도 다루기도 해요!)직접 리눅스의 커널 옵션부터 JVM 옵션, 그리고 Kafka 옵션들도 튜닝해가며 최적의 성능을 지향해요.금융권인만큼 안정적인 이중화 세팅도 되어 있어 여러 클러스터들의 데이터와 오프셋을 싱크 맞춰가며 운영해나가고 있어요.인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>웹프로그래머>백엔드|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>게임(Game)>서버·네트워크개발|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>응용프로그래머>JAVA|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>Python|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>하둡(Hadoop)|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>빅데이터|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>ERP·시스템분석·설계>빅데이터Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 10 days ago

데이터 엔지니어링 팀은 직방의 사용자들로 부터 데이터를 수집하고 데이터 분석에 적합 형태로 처리하며, 데이터를 잘 분석할수 있도록 플랫폼을 구축하며 직방에서 데이터를 보고자하는 사람들과 고객들에게 분석된 데이터를 제공하는 역할을 하고 있습니다.기술적인 측면에서는 대량의 데이터를 적시에 적합한 방법을 통해 제공하기 위해서는 대량 데이터 Processing, 실시간 처리, 시스템 안정성, Data Manipulation, Visualization 등이 필요합니다.해당 기술들을 연구하고 시험해보며 도입하고 실제 적용하는데 있어서 개발자들이 주도적으로 기술적인 Roadmap 을 확장/발전시키고 있으며, 그를 통해 회사의 데이터 활용성을 높이는 목표를 이루는데 있어서 기여하고 있습니다.인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>ERP·시스템분석·설계>AWS|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>데이터베이스·DBA>SQL|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>데이터베이스·DBA>NoSQL|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>응용프로그래머>PythonHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 20 days ago

합류하게 될 팀에 대해 알려드려요토스신용데이터(가칭)의 Data Engineer (Platform)는 토스의 Data Division에 소속되어 있어요. 토스신용데이터(가칭)이 준비법인이기 때문이에요.토스신용데이터(가칭)의 목표는 토스 커뮤니티 및 다양한 금융/비금융 데이터를 통해 대한민국 신용평가 시장을 재정의 하는 거예요. 차별화된 데이터를 결합하고 고도화된 데이터 인프라 및 분석역량을 활용하여, 금융 소비자 중심의 상환 능력 평가를 통해 시장에 새로운 가치를 창출하고자 해요.토스신용데이터(가칭)은 빅데이터와 머신러닝 등 혁신적 신기술을 적극 도입하여 차별화된 방식으로 개인/개인사업자 신용평가 시장을 혁신할 거예요.또한 신용정보원, 제휴사, 토스 커뮤니티 등 다양한 데이터를 한곳으로 모아 방대한 양의 데이터를 처리하는 플랫폼을 운영하고 개발할 거예요.합류하면 함께 할 업무에요안정적이고 효율적인 데이터 플랫폼을 개발하고 운영해요.대규모 데이터 인프라를 설계, 구축, 운영해요.동료들의 안정적이고 효율적인 데이터 실험/분석 환경을 지원해요.인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>하둡(Hadoop)|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>빅데이터|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>Python|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>ERP·시스템분석·설계>빅데이터|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>응용프로그래머>JAVAHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 10 days ago

합류하게 될 팀에 대해 알려드려요토스뱅크의 Data Engineer (CPC) 담당자는 Data Platform팀에 소속되어 있어요.Data Platform 팀에서 여러 대외기관의 CPC(Central Point of Contact)를 관리하고 대응하며, 여신/수신/카드 등 각종 상품 매니저와 긴밀하게 커뮤니케이션 해요.합류하면 함께 할 업무에요CPC대응/공시/정기보고서 등 금융당국에서 요청하는 대외자료를 시스템으로 구현해요.작성된 자료를 자동화하고 데이터의 정합성을 검증하며, Data Quality 관리 체계를 고도화 해요.은행법 등 각종 법령에 따른 보고 업무를 수행해요.이런 분과 함께하고 싶어요인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>ERP·시스템분석·설계>시스템엔지니어|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>ERP·시스템분석·설계>데이터분석|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>데이터분석Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 10 days ago

합류하게 될 팀에 대해 알려드려요토스의 Data Scientist는 ML Engineer, Server Developer, Product Manager 등과 함께 ML팀에 속해있어요.ML팀은 토스에서 사용되는 방대한 사용자 데이터를 통해 비즈니스 인사이트를 도출하기도 하고 더 나은 유저경험을 위해 필요한 다양한 머신러닝 기술을 연구 및 개발하고 있어요.토스만의 신용평가 시스템 및 유저 세그멘테이션 등을 진행하기도 하지만, 그 밖에 바탕으로 유저들에게 맞춤 서비스를 추천하기도 하고 토스 내부적으로 개인정보 보호를 더 효율적으로 할 수 있는 OCR 모델 개발도 준비 중에 있어요.합류하면 함께 할 업무에요토스 서비스 전반에 대한 통계적 분석과 Data Mining / Machine Learning / Deep Learning 기술들을 활용하여 토스 서비스 확장과 최적화, 새로운 가치 발굴에 기여해요.복잡하고 다양한 대용량 데이터와 비즈니스 상황에 적합한 분석 및 모델링을 진행하고, 그에 맞는 최적화와 개선을 수행해요.데이터로부터 특징 추출 및 모델 학습 등의 파이프라인을 설계 및 구축해요.타겟 마케팅: 타겟 세그먼트 발굴 / 최적화 등 관련된 모델링을 진행해요.인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>빅데이터|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>머신러닝|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>딥러닝|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>빅데이터·AI(인공지능)>Python|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>데이터베이스·DBA>데이터사이언스|인터넷·IT·통신·모바일·게임>데이터베이스·DBA>SQLHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 10 days ago

Data 개발자 영입 FAQ 페이지 바로가기[온라인 설명회 일정 안내]데이터 분야 4개의 팀, 그리고 인재영입팀이 함께 온라인 설명회를 진행합니다.지원에 망설임이 있으시다면 이번 설명회를 통해카카오 Data 팀의 목표와 일하는 방식을 참고해보세요!설명회는 물론 이번 영입에 지원을 희망하시는 분들을 위한 프로그램이나평소 카카오의 Data 팀이 궁금하셨던 모든 분들을 위한 자리이니이번 영입에 지원을 희망하지 않으시는 분들이라도편하게 신청해주시면 감사하겠습니다. ‍ ️온라인 설명회 [총 2회 진행] 응용분석팀 & 추천팀6/23(목) 오후 8시 ~ 10시① 20:00 ~ 20:15 오프닝 및 영입프로세스, 카카오 문화 소개② 20:15 ~ 20:45 응용분석팀 모집 포지션 및 업무/문화/비전 소개③ 20:45 ~ 21:05 응용분석팀 Q&A④ 21:05 ~ 21:35 추천팀 모집 포지션 및 업무/문화/비전 소개⑤ 21:35 ~ 21:55 추천팀 Q&A 데이터정보플랫폼팀 & 광고추천팀6/27(월) 오후 8시 ~ 10시① 20:00 ~ 20:15 오프닝 및 영입프로세스, 카카오 문화 소개② 20:15 ~ 20:45 데이터정보플랫폼팀 모집 포지션 및 업무/문화/비전 소개③ 20:45 ~ 21:05 데이터정보플랫폼팀 Q&A④ 21:05 ~ 21:35 광고추천팀 모집 포지션 및 업무/문화/비전 소개⑤ 21:35 ~ 21:55 광고추천팀 Q&A설명회 참석 링크는 사전 신청을 해주신 분들을 대상으로 공유되며,상세한 안내는 아래 참석 링크를 통해 확인 가능합니다.︎ 설명회 참여 신청︎ 설명회 사전 질문 등록※ 설명회 진행이 임박한 시점에 신청해주시면 참여 링크 전달이 늦어질 수 있는 점 참고 부탁드립니다[모집 공고]상세 분야의 지원자격 및 업무내용은 각 공고를 클릭하시면 확인 가능합니다.각 공고 별로 해당 조직에 대해 소개된 테크 블로그 링크를 기재해 두었으니,꼼꼼히 살펴보시고 지원에 참고 부탁드립니다![ ︎ 응용분석팀 ] (총 3개)응용분석팀은 데이터 자산 가치 창출 및 극대화라는 목표를 달성하기 위해다양한 기술과 아이디어를 현실화하고 있습니다.카카오 생태계에서 발생하는 모든 데이터를 다루고 해석할 수 있기에,넓은 시야로 다양한 데이터를 탐색하여응용 가능한 방법론과 인사이트들을 찾아냅니다.자세한 내용은 설명회와 팀 소개글 참고 부탁드립니다.ㄴ 카카오 데이터의 가치를 발굴할 데이터 분석가ㄴ 사용자 프로파일 연구 및 개발ㄴ 머신러닝 모델 연구 및 개발 응용분석팀이 더 궁금하다면?[ ︎ 추천팀 ] (총 2개)카카오 추천팀에서는 카카오 공동체에 추천 기술을 제공하고 있습니다.카카오톡, 다음, 선물하기, 멜론, 픽코마(웹툰), 카카오페이지, 브런치 등15개 서비스에서 추천팀의 추천 기술을 사용하고 있습니다.ㄴ 추천 시스템 연구/개발ㄴ 추천/ML SaaS 플랫폼 SW 엔지니어 추천팀이 더 궁금하다면? 추천팀 소개 바로가기 추천팀 문의처 바로가기[ ︎ 데이터정보플랫폼팀 ] (총 1개)데이터를 모으고 정보를 찾아내는 플랫폼 서비스를 만드는 팀 입니다.ㄴ 데이터 수집, 분석 플랫폼 개발 엔지니어 데이터정보플랫폼팀이 더 궁금하다면?[ ︎ 광고추천팀 ] (총 2개)‘데이터의 가치가 돈으로 측정되는 곳, 인터넷 비즈니스의 꽃 광고, 광고 비즈니스의 꽃 광고 추천’,‘광고 도메인에서 데이터 사이언스 및 엔지니어링 융합된 형태의 완결된 서비스를 경험할 수 있는 곳’ㄴ 데이터 사이언스, 머신러닝 전문가ㄴ 광고 추천 시스템 개발자 광고추천팀이 더 궁금하다면?[전형방법 및 일정]º 서류 전형 : 6월 17일 (금) ~ 7/8(금) 15:00서류 마감 이후 진행되는 전형 일정은 각 공고 별로 상이하오니, 지원을 희망하시는 공고의 상세 안내 확인 바랍니다.※ 일정은 변경될 수 있으며, 각 전형 결과는 개별적으로 안내드릴 예정입니다.※ 지원서 접수 마감 시 접속량이 많아 접수에 어려움이 예상되오니 사전 지원을 권장드립니다.카카오에서는 앞으로도 더욱 많은 개발자분들과 함께하기위해새롭고 유의미한 영입이 활발하게 진행될 예정입니다.언제나 카카오의 영입 사이트를 관심있게 주목해주시길 바라며,카카오톡에서 [카카오 인재영입] 채널을 추가해두시면,다른 부문 영입 진행 시 개별 알림톡 을 발송드릴 예정이니 참고 부탁드립니다. 카카오 인재영입 채널 추가 바로가기 필독사항※ 영입 포지션 직군 경력 1년 미만일 시 추가 역량 검증을 위해 정직원 최종 합격 전, 최대 3개월간 계약직으로 근무할 수 있습니다. (단, 신입공채 전형 합격자의 경우에는 관련 경력 1년 미만이라도 정규직으로 입사하게 됩니다.) 근로제도해당 포지션은 월 단위로 정해진 총 근로시간 범위 내에서 본인이 스스로 근로시간을 유연하게 설정하여 근무하는 "완전선택적근로제도"를 적용 받습니다.이 경우 본인이 스스로 업무의 시작 및 종료시각을 일 단위로 등록하여 공유하며, 월 소정 근로시간을 채우면 됩니다.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 3 days ago

We are looking for a Data Engineer to work in our Multi billion dollars business to help shape the future of the Data Strategy for brands such as Gillette, Braun, Venus and much more. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and building solutions using various modern Azure components & tools. You will lead delivery of E2E scalable data & analytics applications using outstanding industry standards, actively coding and adapting them to ensure their resiliency and fit to requirements. Responsibilities: Craft and build scalable and resilient Data & Analytics solutions in Microsoft Azure – architect technical solutions to obtain, process, store and provide insights based on processed data. Develop, within existing designs of various solutions in Microsoft Azure, environments to help generate valuable insights. Work on automation and optimization of internal processes in Azure. Influence the future of these new technologies and the ways in which P&G uses them. Have a possibility to work with multifunctional and multinational teams within and outside of P&G. Focus on key business cases development within Data & Analytics + Azure. Manage agile projects using cloud and hybrid solutions. What we offer: Responsibilities as of day 1. You will have project ownership and autonomy to deliver change and results from the beginning. Dynamic and encouraging work environment. At P&G our employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance. Continuous mentoring, you will work with hardworking people and receive ongoing coaching and mentoring from your line manager and other colleagues. Corporate and functional training will enable you to succeed and develop from day one. Industry Certifications (ITIL, DevOps, MS portfolio etc), full additional benefit program like private health care, P&G Dynamic Living programs like sport cards, in-office fitness center, PG stock options, saving plans, lunch subsidy, regular salary increases and possible promotions, flexible work arrangements, mentoring programs & trainings. Big Picture understanding of P&G IT organization and its Services in global multi-functional teams with several locations across continents. Who we are: P&G was founded over 180 years ago as a simple soap and candle company. Today, we are the world’s largest consumer goods company and home to iconic, trusted brands that make life a little bit easier in small but meaningful ways. We’ve spanned three centuries thanks to three simple ideas: leadership, innovation and citizenship. The insight, innovation and passion of hardworking teams has helped us grow into a global company that is governed responsibly and ethically, that is open and transparent, and that supports good causes and protects the environment. We commit to provide you with equal opportunities in employment! We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Qualifications Qualifications Business / Management Information Systems or Software Development, Information Technology. Python and SQL programming skills. Cloud Understanding. Understanding of data modelling. Understanding of CI/CD. English proficiency and at least a Bachelor's degree. Nice to have Understanding of Spark framework and distributed architecture features and challenges. Experience in implementing projects & solutions using Microsoft Azure stack (eg. Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Service, SQL Server, Azure Synapse). Knowledge of SCRUM and DevOps methodologies. Hands on experience in writing clean, effective code. Job detailsJob TypePart-timeInternshipBenefitsPulled from the full job descriptionFlextimeFull Job DescriptionBarcelona - Data Engineer - Part time  800€/mes   Última actualización: February 10, 2022  Sobre la posición IOMED es una empresa especializada en la extracción y el procesamiento de datos médicos a través de herramientas de Inteligencia Artificial como Machine Learning y Procesamiento de Lenguaje Natural. Estructuramos la información clínica con el objetivo de acelerar la investigación clínica. La beca está orientada a estudiantes de Data Science o Data Engineer que tengan interés y curiosidad en nuevas tecnologías y, en particular, en el sector Healthcare. Tareas En el equipo de Data Engineer tus principales tareas serán:Consultas en las bases de datos SQL (concretamente PostgreSQL).Dar apoyo en modelado e implementación de la base de datos SQL.Realización de ETLs con SQL y Python.Lo que esperamos de ti Buscamos una persona para trabajar en el departamento de Data Engineer, por lo que deberá ser detallista, con gran capacidad de concentración y análisis. Además, buscamos un perfil que tenga experiencia utilizando o trabajando con bases de datos SQL. Se trata de una experiencia enriquecedora, ya que se encararán proyectos de diversas áreas, además de trabajar rodeada de grandes profesionales con ganas de ayudar al crecimiento profesional del futuro talento. Qué ofrecemosContrato de prácticas de 6 meses.Jornada parcial.800€/mes.Horario flexible.Equipo cálido, transparente y solidario, con gran énfasis en la conciliación de la vida laboral y personal.Posibilidad de formación dentro de la empresa.Flexibilidad con el trabajo a distancia.La mayoría de los días, comida conjunta en nuestra soleada terraza.Sobre nosotros IOMED es una empresa tecnológica de nueva creación puntera en el campo de la extracción y el procesamiento masivo de datos médicos. Lo compone un equipo pequeño, unido, joven, dinámico y flexible, que, tras varios años de trabajo en conjunto, se caracteriza por su agilidad, disfrute del trabajo y compenetración. Acorde, buscamos candidatos con ganas de innovar, lanzar un proyecto relevante y crecer con él, siempre disfrutando cada día del trabajo en equipo y de los retos, que son muchos. Nuestro “dream team” está formado por estadísticos, bioinformáticos, gente del mundo de los negocios y la medicina. En IOMED los modelos que desarrolles analizarán cientos de millones de textos hospitalarios, ayudando a extraer variables que acelerarán la investigación clínica. Como empleador, ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades. Todavía somos un equipo pequeño y estamos comprometidos a crecer de manera inclusiva. Queremos aumentar nuestro equipo con personas talentosas y dinámicas, independientemente de su raza, color, religión, nacionalidad, sexo, discapacidad física o edad. IOMED acelera la investigación clínica mediante la explotación de textos clínicos a través de NLP. Con este propósito, hemos desarrollado nuestro propio marco de NLP, que integra una serie de modelos para resolver tareas como el reconocimiento y la vinculación con renombradas entidades, la extracción de relaciones, la desambiguación del sentido de las palabras, la clasificación de textos y la clasificación de entidades. Estos algoritmos se encuentran actualmente en ejecución en varios hospitales de España, aplicándose a millones de textos clínicos. Lo que hacemos Hoy en día, alrededor del 50% de los ensayos clínicos se retrasan debido al reclutamiento de pacientes, ya que la recopilación de datos de pacientes se realiza de forma manual. Como resultado, la investigación clínica es altamente ineficiente tanto en tiempo como en costo, por lo que lleva años y miles de millones de dólares desarrollar un nuevo medicamento. Este problema podría resolverse a través de datos del mundo real, es decir, aquellos contenidos en las historias clínicas electrónicas (HCE). Pero desafortunadamente, hasta el 85% de los datos clínicos existentes no están estructurados, es decir, en texto plano. IOMED ha encontrado la solución a esta situación, haciendo posible aprovechar al máximo el valor de los datos clínicos del mundo real. Desarrollamos una herramienta que extrae los datos necesarios de los textos clínicos, lo que da como resultado una base de datos estructurada, estandarizada e interoperable que contiene la información clínica completa de los hospitales. De este modo, la información no reutilizable se transforma en datos disponibles para la Investigación clínica, lo que permite incrementar la cantidad de pacientes que cumplen con los criterios, así como reducir el tiempo total y el trabajo manual dedicado a esta tarea.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30 days ago

Job detailsJob TypePermanentFull Job DescriptioneDreams ODIGEO is one of the world’s largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe. We are building a world-class Online Marketing Technology organization and we are seeking a highly motivated and driven Data Analytics Engineer / R or Python developer to design, implement and maintain data pipelines along with running high quality analysis. Data is at the core of our online marketing campaigns and in this role you’ll work with key marketing leaders to understand their business domain (search engine marketing, app marketing, display advertising, retargeting) and how data can empower them. You will work along with other Analysts, Data Scientists and SW developers and will drive automation and insights for the eDreams Odigeo internal marketing teams, which are among the top Google, Microsoft Bing, Facebook and Criteo customers by spend in Europe. The Online Marketing Technology team members are passionate about data, automation, statistical models, technology and innovation and love to work in a collaborative and agile environment. Team members are eager to learn and grow, to deep dive into things, to share constructive feedback and they welcome feedback from other team members. They also love challenging the status quo and are constantly thinking of new ways of doing things. You will be spending most of the time on data manipulation (pulling and merging data from external data sources through API’s or internal cloud, building dashboards, analyzing trends, etc.) with the end goal to build algorithms for intelligent task automation. This newly created position will report directly to the Head of Marketing Technology and Insights and does not have any direct reports. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel! job_description: Job Function: Technical Delivery Center- Services Why SoftwareONE?:   ¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera en un área clave en los próximos años? ¿Sueñas con diseñar y migrar entornos Cloud? ¿Ayudar a garantizar que sean seguros y óptimos?  Si es así, sigue leyendo. Estamos buscando a una persona para unirse a nuestro equipo de Infraestructura. Nosotros trabajamos con Google Cloud Platform y ya contamos con un equipo senior TOP, por eso, ahora queremos incorporar personas con poca experiencia, pero muchas ganas.  The role:   ¿Qué buscamos en ti? Si tienes   de 2 a 4 años de experiencia trabajando en el área de Business Intelligence, con Ingeniería Superior,   preferiblemente en Informática, te estamos buscando.  Necesitamos que tengas un perfil técnico en   Big Data y Business Intelligence, pero además que tengas buena capacidad para entender las necesidades funcionales del negocio.  Queremos que nos aportes:  Conocimiento avanzado de consultas SQL y ETL. Experiencia trabajando con BBDD relacionales y no relacionales. Experiencia en calidad de datos. Experiencia programando en Python. Alto nivel de inglés hablado y escrito. Valoramos muy positivamente:  Experiencia con el ecosistema de Google de Big Data. Experiencia en tareas de desarrollo utilizando los patrones TDD y/o BDD. Experiencia en tareas de desarrollo con Apache Spark o Apache Hadoop. Habilidades interpersonales, incluida la comunicación oral y escrita.   #LI-LP1  What we need to see from you:   ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones? Vas a participar como   Consultor/a Senior en los proyectos de Business Intelligence y Machine Learning que se llevan a cabo. Algunas de tus funciones van a ser:  Participar en los procesos de preventa en las oportunidades del área. Adquirir un fuerte conocimiento del ecosistema y de las principales soluciones de Business Intelligence incluidas en la propuesta de valor de la empresa: Google BigQuery, Google DataFlow, Google DataPrep, TensorFlow, Data Studio, Tableau, etc. Estar en contacto permanente con las soluciones de terceros que complementan el ecosistema de Business Intelligence, asegurando el conocimiento de las mismas dentro del equipo. ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte? Desarrollamos tu futuro profesional a medida. Nos encargamos de ofrecerte la mejor experiencia del mercado como empleado en relación a tu formación, desarrollo profesional y personal. Take your English to the next level! Avanzarás en tu nivel de inglés, en menos de un año tu nivel de inglés evolucionará de una forma extraordinaria. Con clases de inglés personalizadas, grupos, cafés y una plataforma especializada para ti. Trabajar con las tecnologías más punteras es fundamental en el mundo IT. Tu formación es lo más importante, abogamos por compartir nuestro conocimiento y apostamos por tu desarrollo profesional, a través de formaciones y certificaciones técnicas. Podrás obtener los beneficios sociales que quieras en cada momento. Cada momento de la vida tiene unas necesidades distintas y nos hemos dado cuenta. Tendrás un presupuesto personalizado y podrás elegir los que prefieras en cada momento, los tenemos todos!! Queremos que tu vida personal sea lo más feliz posible. Por ello, la conciliación, la flexibilidad y el teletrabajo forman parte de nuestros valores y nuestra forma de trabajar.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 17 days ago

Auto req ID: 280134BR  Job Description #Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world famous portfolio of brands are sold every day. Our Data Science & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world. Join PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team which develops quality data collection processes, maintains the integrity of our data foundations and enables business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation. Role summary As a Data Engineer, you will be the key technical expert overseeing PepsiCo's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create a positive impact on the business.   What will you be doing more specifically Active contributor to code development in projects and services. Manage and scale data pipelines from internal and external data sources to support new product launches and drive data quality across data products. Build and own the automation and monitoring frameworks that captures metrics and operational KPIs for data pipeline quality and performance. Responsible for implementing best practices around systems integration, security, performance and data management. Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape. Collaborate with internal clients (data science and product teams) to drive solutioning and POC discussions. Develop and optimize procedures to “productionalize” data science models. Define and manage SLA’s for data products and processes running in production. Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale. Create and audit reusable packages or libraries. Qualifications/Requirements Minimum Qualifications: 3+ years of hands on experience with software development, data engineering, or systems architecture: 3+ years of experience with Data Lake Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, and ETL/ELT pipelines. 3+ years of experience in SQL optimization and performance tuning, and development experience in programming languages like Python, PySpark, Scala etc.). 2+ years in cloud data engineering experience in at least one cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP). Experience in the following areas: Hands-on experience in developing Data Analytics Solutions in Cloud environments: designing, implementing, deploying, and monitoring in agile methodology by understanding CI/CD principles Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining. Preferred Qualifications: Experience on Azure Data Platform Experience in data modeling; understanding of Data Architecture Layers Multi-source management, enrichment; Data Cleansing Data-oriented mindset with an emphasis on compliance awareness (e.g.: PI, GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) Additional Qualifications: Analytical approach to problem-solving; excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements. Strong change manager: comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth. High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously. What makes us different? Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities Diverse team from over 25 countries Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing Free Friday afternoon & during the month of August Relocation package & sponsorship to work in Spain if applicable About PepsiCo We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo D+A. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world. PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.  So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat. We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability PepsiCo Data & Analytics Overview:  With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise. Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation Job Type: RegularHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 1 day ago

About JLL – We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities. Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together. If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table! About JLL and JLL Technologies JLL is a leading professional services firm that specializes in real estate and investment management. Our vision is to reimagine the world of real estate, creating rewarding opportunities and amazing spaces where people can achieve their ambitions. In doing so, we will build a better tomorrow for our clients, our people and our communities. JLL Technologies is a specialized group within JLL. At JLL Technologies, our mission is to bring technology innovation to commercial real estate. We deliver unparalleled digital advisory, implementation, and services solutions to organizations globally. Our goal is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.  What this job involves  JLL Technologies Enterprise Data team is a newly established central organization that oversees JLL’s data strategy. We are seeking data professionals to work with our colleagues at JLL around the globe in providing solutions, developing new products, building enterprise reporting & analytics capability to reshape the business of Commercial Real Estate using the power of data and we are just getting started on that journey! We are looking for a Staff Data Engineer who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Enterprise Data team. This is an individual contributor role that is responsible for designing and developing of data solutions that are strategic for the business and built on the latest technologies and patterns. This a global role that requires partnering with the broader JLLT team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data engineering experience. As a Staff Data Engineer at JLL Technologies, you will: Design, Architect, and Develop solutions leveraging cloud big data technology to ingest, process and analyze large, disparate data sets to exceed business requirements  Develop systems that ingest, cleanse and normalize diverse datasets, develop data pipelines from various internal and external sources and build structure for previously unstructured data  Interact with internal colleagues and external professionals to determine requirements, anticipate future needs, and identify areas of opportunity to drive data development  Develop good understanding of how data will flow & stored through an organization across multiple applications such as CRM, Broker & Sales tools, Finance, HR etc  Unify, enrich, and analyze variety of data to derive insights and opportunities  Design & develop data management and data persistence solutions for application use cases leveraging relational, non-relational databases and enhancing our data processing capabilities  Develop POCs to influence platform architects, product managers and software engineers to validate solution proposals and migrate  Develop data lake solution to store structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources and provide technical guidance to help migrate colleagues to modern technology platform  Contribute and adhere to CI/CD processes, development best practices and strengthen the discipline in Data Engineering Org  Mentor other members in the team and organization and contribute to organizations’ growth. What we are looking for: 6+ years’ work experience and bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in science, business, or social science.  Hands-on engineer who is curious about technology, should be able to quickly adopt to change and one who understands the technologies supporting areas such as Cloud Computing (AWS, Azure(preferred), etc.), Micro Services, Streaming Technologies, Network, Security, etc.  3 or more years of active development experience as a data developer using Python-spark, Spark Streaming, Azure SQL Server, Cosmos DB/Mongo DB, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Search etc.  Design & develop data management and data persistence solutions for application use cases leveraging relational, non-relational databases and enhancing our data processing capabilities  Build, test and enhance data curation pipelines integration data from wide variety of sources like DBMS, File systems, APIs and streaming systems for various KPIs and metrics development with high data quality and integrity  Maintain the health and monitoring of assigned data engineering capabilities that span analytic functions by triaging maintenance issues; ensure high availability of the platform; monitor workload demands; work with Infrastructure Engineering teams to maintain the data platform; serve as an SME of one or more application  Team player, Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of executing on multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment working with cross functional teams  3+ years of experience working with source code control systems and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment tools  Independent and able to manage, prioritize & lead workload What you can expect from us: You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...  JLL is an Equal Opportunity Employer JLL is an equal opportunity employer and committed to recruiting, developing and maintaining a diverse workforce in compliance with all applicable Human Rights legislation. The Company will endeavor to make reasonable accommodations up to the point of undue hardship, for disabilities made known to it by its employees and applicants.  Apply today! #LI-MR3 #Remote What you can expect from us We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Company Description  Devoteam G Cloud Sweden is part of the Devoteam group. We are a premier partner of the Google Cloud Platform, focusing on implementing innovative GCP solutions together with our customers. Our team of experts is built around the trust that we give each other. We are curious about the ever-changing technology and have the courage to challenge the status quo and try new, innovative approaches. If you want to know more about what it’s like to be a part of our team, get in touch and join us on our journey! Job Description  As a Senior Data Engineer at Devoteam you will work as a part of the specialized team helping customers to innovate and improve their business. The main purpose is to design, develop and deliver original, high-quality and tailor-made data solutions. In the role of Senior Data Engineer you will use your knowledge and experience to find the best - rather than the easiest - answer to their needs. You will communicate closely with the customer to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Being part of a team also means you have a shared ownership and responsibility of helping the team in the development process to solve the right problems in the right way. Some of the daily duties will include designing data warehousing along with developing data pipelines and databases for customer projects. Qualifications  This is a client-facing position and we believe that you are enthusiastic about your work, open to new ideas and service-minded. We also expect you to be structured and have the ability to prioritize tasks. With that comes the capacity to multitask and run several projects in parallel. As a Senior team member you should have a passion for tech and enjoy teamwork to exchange ideas and support other team members through challenges related to data architecture, engineering and the overall technology stack. It is important to have a drive to learn and develop your own skills. To succeed in this role we believe you have: Solid programming skills in Python (or equivalent, i.e. Scala, Java) Experience working with databases, data pipelines and data warehouses Cloud experience - preferably with GCP, but AWS and Azure are also applicable Full proficiency in English Additional Information  We offer you: Encouragement and support (taking form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage and financial incentives) for training and certification Challenging and rewarding assignments; many of them end-to-end Wellness grants for sports activities (5000 SEK/year) Passionate and skilled colleagues A human-centric and value-based culture Full coverage of the work tools A variety of social events About Devoteam G Cloud: We are a part of Devoteam, a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. With 25 years experience and 8,000 employees across Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change. Combining the perks of a smaller company with the resources and opportunities of a major global player, Devoteam G Cloud Sweden is part of a network of companies within the global Devoteam group. The smaller team size makes sure you are always seen and helps facilitate your growth and development in a personalized manner, while the global network opens up endless opportunities to create a large impact. Creating high quality digital products by combining creativity, design and development is what we do. We focus on running projects that deliver measurable business value for the clients we choose to work with. We incorporate ‘design thinking’ and ‘data thinking’ into everything we do. Competence development is at the center of our company culture and we invest both time and money in supporting our employees’ growth. With established competence communities you are always able to discuss and review solutions, technical ideas and issues with others within your competence areas. We also have dedicated competence days and regularly have internal knowledge sharing days. A fair chance. Devoteam is open to applications from all sections of society. We believe diverse teams help us make better products. We welcome all people regardless of age, gender identity or expression, experience and background. Our recruitment process We aim to provide you with a swift and pleasant experience in a casual and friendly atmosphere. After the initial conversation with a member of the recruitment team you will have two interviews (usually done via online video calls, but can also be done in person if you are located in Stockholm) where you will have a chance to meet your future colleagues from both the technical and business teams.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 6 days ago

job_title: System developer / Data Engineer to SEB
job_description: Categories        Data & IT, Technology               30 August 2022       Location        Stockholm           SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a significant impact for our customers and colleagues.          Does that sound like a good fit for you?     What you will be doing      Reporting Solutions at Technology Common Functions delivers IT services to most of the central financial control functions at SEB including compliance reporting to Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority. We are now in an intensive strategic development phase – collecting and refining the tools, data, and processes for migration towards Cloud.          We are looking for an experienced system developer in Oracle (PL/SLQ), SAS (EG, Base, Viya, VA), Python, someone who is curious about the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and wants to grow into a role as Data Engineer/Cloud Engineer.         (Psst! If you already are an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst familiar with GCP – you might be the perfect fit for us! Since there are a lot of exciting things happening in our team, we also might have a role for the one who is passionate about system and server maintenance in SAS in a Linux environment. As you can hear, the possibilities are wide so let us discuss them when we meet!)     As a Solution Developer you will be responsible for:  Your own learning journey towards new modern technologies in accordance with the IT Roadmap. Actively contribute to the team daily operation, planning and development of our deliveries Proactively join the stive towards automation (DevSecOps) and enhancement of current processes Implement the short- and long-term strategy to build, operate and maintain the applications we build Refine the strategy and define our roadmap as well as implementing it with data owners, architects, tech leads and development teams. Who we are looking for      We believe that you like to find creative solutions to complex problems, like innovative modern technologies and are passionate about agile ways of working. We also believe that you are analytical, curious and have a passion for discovering new ways of working. As a person, you are communicative, driven, collaborative and a real team player. You will thrive extra well with us if you are interested in finance and asset management.          Other skills we are looking for:      You have at least 5 years of experience from Oracle, SAS, or Google Cloud. You have broad knowledge of SQL You have previous experience or genuine interest in learning Google Cloud Platform and Python You like to operate what you and the team build (DevOps) You are fluent in English spoken and written You are probably a university graduate      It is extra meritorious if you      Speak Swedish Have experience of working with BI-tools such as Tableau or any other presentation tools. What we offer      In this position you will be able to combine working from one of the most modern and inspiring offices, with the possibility to work from your home. You will together with your manager discuss the best set-up for you and the team before you start. Other than that, the core of our offering is:      Extensive training and learning opportunities  Work-life balance  Friendly and welcoming culture Attractive compensation and benefits Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits Innovative company in forefront of technology Challenging, innovative work Opportunities to help transform an industry Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career          It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.      Ready to join?      Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31-08-22. If you have questions about the position please contact Patrick Schwalbe, Hiring manager, at patrik.schwalbe@seb.se     Welcome to a community of tech-savvy and passionate employees from all corners of the world. SEB is in fact one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Together we future proof a world of financial flows by exploring and implementing modern digital architecture and state-of-the-art technology. We are driven by collaboration, insight, and friendship. But also, a desire to change and improve. All in all, it creates a balance - where life and a stable yet exciting job can co-exist. If you want to shape tomorrow's bank - continue reading and apply today. Read more: sebgroup.com/techcareers    Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 2 days ago

Engineering              Data           The Personalization team makes deciding what to play next easier and more enjoyable for every listener. From Blend to Discover Weekly, we’re behind some of Spotify’s most-loved features. We built them by understanding the world of music and podcasts better than anyone else. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening by making great recommendations to each and every one of them. We ask that our team members be physically located in Central European time or Eastern Standard/Daylight time zones for the purposes of our collaboration hours.    Location     Stockholm or Remote EMEA    Job type     Permanent        We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team based across Europe who’s working on applying and experimenting with state of the art machine learning techniques to guide every user to a satisfying listening experience. If you want to be part of a diverse cross functional squad focused on building new innovative ideas, this is a great opportunity for you. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening to great recommendations every day!    What You'll Do Collaborate closely with our machine learning engineers to help them scale up user and content understanding at Spotify Build large-scale batch and real-time data processing systems with Scala, and cloud platforms. Continuously improve our code base by working with innovative data processing frameworks, technologies, and platforms. Work in multi-functional teams with end-to-end responsibility for product development and delivery within the mission. Who You Are You are knowledgeable and driven about software engineering. We use languages such as Python, Java, Scala and SQL combined with various cloud solutions. Although you might not have a background in our field, bringing knowledge and experience from other fields is merited. You have experience working with high volume heterogeneous data, preferably with data processing frameworks like Apache Beam, Apache Spark, Apache Flink. You care deeply about agile software processes, reliability, and responsible experimentation as well as being a strong advocate for engineering best practices such as continuous integration and delivery. You have a proven understanding of data modeling, data access, and data storage, caching, replication, and optimization techniques. You understand the value of collaboration within teams. You are comfortable with asynchronous communication, being able to work independently while always sharing context with your team members. You love your customers even more than your code Experience with backend engineering is a plus. Experience working with Machine Learning is a plus. Where You'll Be We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them. Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the EMEA region in which we have a work location and is within working hours. Working hours? We operate within the Central European and GMT time zones for collaboration and ask that all be located that time zone. Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here. Our global benefits     Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.        Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.        Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.        All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.        Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.        Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.    Learn about life at Spotify     Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.    Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure        Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.   Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 5 days ago

job_title: Junior Data Engineer to Malmö - IBM CIC
job_description: Introduction Are you passionate about tech and looking to boost your career in a fast-paced and friendly working environment? Then look no further!   IBM Consulting Sweden is growing, and we now have a range of opportunities for early professionals/recent graduates. So, whether you are looking to work in DevOps, Data Science, Data Engineering, Analytics, we would love to hear from you.  Your Role and ResponsibilitiesYou are: Located in/near or happy to relocate to Malmö. Our priority is the well-being of IBMers, candidates and the communities we operate in and many IBMers are working remotely during these times. However, on-site presence will be expected once circumstances permit. A young professional or recent/soon to be graduate uncovering the stories hidden in data and finding patterns in the numbers. You’ll put this skill to solve business problems by preparing, analyzing, and understanding data to deliver insight, predict emerging trends, and provide recommendations for better results. You’ll use a variety of data (structured, unstructured, IoT streaming), analytics, AI tools, and programming languages often using a cloud infrastructure to handle the volume and veracity of data streams. What you could be doing as a Junior Data Engineer/Scientist:Transforming our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes, and collaborating on product development Designing and implementing analytical capabilities for a data & analytical ecosystem Delivering data according to the need, working with different data source types Implementing and validating predictive models as well as create and maintain statistical models with a focus on big data Incorporating a variety of statistical and machine learning techniques Communicating with internal and external clients to understand and define business needs, providing analytical solutions Using leading edge tools such as R Library, Python, tensor-flow combined with IBM tools and our AI application suites Working in an Agile, collaborative environment, partnering with engineers, consultants and database administrators of all backgrounds and disciplines to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of predicting behaviors Building teams or writing programs to cleanse and integrate data in an efficient and reusable manner, developing predictive or prescriptive models, and evaluating modeling results Asking business and industry questions to identify appropriate modeling techniques Communicating results to technical and non-technical audiences The selection is continuous and the role will be filled as soon as possible.This is a job of IBM Client Innovation Center Sweden AB.Required Technical and Professional Expertise For these roles we look for team-workers with passion for tech and an appetite for large enterprise solutions who have   Minimum Bachelor’s degree in the Information Technology area Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English Most likely you also have   Strong fundamentals in Mathematics and Computer Science (algorithms) Experience with programming/scripting in a language such as Java or Python Proficiency in at least one of the statistical programming languages such as R, Python, Scala or SAS, SPSS, Matlab Basic understanding or experience with predictive/prescriptive modeling skills and Cloud (AWS, Azure, etc) Interest in ever changing, technology-based service environments – motivated by solving client problems together Willingness to learn new skills and continuously expand your knowledge base Passion for extracting hidden insights and building machine learning systems that enhance business outcomes Don’t worry if you don’t meet all the required technical criteria. If you have a passion for problem-solving, are a quick learner and logical thinker, we would still like to hear from you and find out how you can become part of the IBM Client Innovation Center.  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise None.   You must be eligible to work in Sweden when applying.  About Business Unit IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.  Your Life @ IBM Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.   Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.   It's time to define your career.  About IBM IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.   Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.    At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  Location Statement IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.  Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 25 days ago

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionAs a Data Engineer at Offerta, you will be part of a small team responsible for enabling data driven products and insights in a complex marketplace. In essence, the team makes sure that the right data is in the right place. Though this might sound like a straightforward task, it allows the team to work in many interesting domains: developing and serving machine learning models, leading Offerta's adoption of Kafka, and continuously improving the reliability of data pipelines, to name a few. You don’t need to be a master of any of these domains, but you should be motivated by continuously learning new things! In the role as a data engineer you will:Collaborate closely with other data engineers in the teamDevelop modern Python applications to serve and process dataBuild and maintain data pipelines using tools such as Kafka, Argo, Spark and dbtServe machine learning models, and partake in their developmentContinuously improve how Offerta works with dataWork with Kubernetes using tools such as Helm and Terraform If any of these tasks are new to you, we hope that’s a motivator! The team loves to tread new ground, and learn together. We think you are already comfortable with: Transforming and structuring dataQuerying complex data using SQLSoftware development principlesTerminal based workflows Also, a lot of the internal communication at Offerta is in Swedish, so you should either already speak Swedish or have an interest in learning. What's it in for you?Newly renovated office at Sveavägen 98, near OdenplanFreedom to work part time remoteFlexible working hoursGenerous Wellness allowance and time of work to workoutHackathon weeks and opportunities for all Developers to set aside time for new innovation, ideas and skill development About Offerta Offerta is Sweden's largest marketplace for services. Every year about 100,000 people turn to us to find the right service professionals, mainly for construction, moving and cleaning. Offerta was founded in 2008 to change and simplify the way we buy services. We help companies find new customers, and customers to find great service professionals. Our team is located in Malmö, Stockholm and Helsinki and together, we share a passion for solving problems. Our curious minds make us responsive and solution-oriented and we approach business challenges from all angles. By doing this, we help clients to become customer-centric by combining our capabilities within business transformation, service design, technology, data-driven marketing, and content.
